t: Isaiah Called to Be a Prophet
In*p the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His robe*i filled the temple.
Above it stood seraphim; each one had six wings: with two he covered his face, with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.
And one cried to another and said: “Holy,*pn holy, holy is*i the Lord*s of hosts; The*ld whole earth is*i full of His glory!”
And*p the posts of the door were shaken by the voice of him who cried out, and the house was filled with smoke.

So*p I said: “Woe*pn is*i me, for I am undone! Because*ld I am*i a man of unclean lips, And*ld I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; For*ld my eyes have seen the King, The*ld Lord*s of hosts.”
Then*p one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a live coal which*i he had taken with the tongs from the altar.
And he touched my mouth with*i it,*i and said: “Behold,*pn this has touched your lips; Your*ld iniquity is taken away, And*ld your sin purged.”
Also*p I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: “Whom*pn shall I send, And*ld who will go for Us?” Then*p I said, “Here am*i I! Send me.”
And*p He said, “Go, and tell this people: ‘Keep*pn on hearing, but do not understand; Keep*ld on seeing, but do not perceive.’

“Make*ln the heart of this people dull, And*ld their ears heavy, And*ld shut their eyes; Lest*ld they see with their eyes, And*ld hear with their ears, And*ld understand with their heart, And*ld return and be healed.”
Then*p I said, “Lord, how long?” And*p He answered: “Until*pn the cities are laid waste and without inhabitant, The*ld houses are without a man, The*ld land is utterly desolate,
The*ld Lord*s has removed men far away, And*ld the forsaken places are*i many in the midst of the land.

But*ld yet a tenth will*i be*i in it, And*ld will return and be for consuming, As*ld a terebinth tree or as an oak, Whose*ld stump remains*i when it is cut down. So*ld the holy seed shall*i be*i its stump.”
